projects.name: Hospital-Management
projects.reasoning: The repository is a MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, Node.js) Hospital Management System. It involves both front-end (React, HTML, CSS, Tailwind CSS) and back-end (Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB) development, aligning well with the job description's requirements for back-end web development, front-end skills, and programming knowledge. The use of REST APIs, JWT for authentication, and database interaction (MongoDB) further increases relevance.

projects.name: Backend
projects.reasoning: The repository demonstrates backend web development skills using Node.js, Express, and MongoDB, aligning with the internship's requirements for backend development, programming, and OOP. It showcases API development and authentication, which are relevant to the role. The mention of React and Node.js in the job description strengthens the match.

projects.name: Banaras-Mart-Backend
projects.reasoning: The repository is a backend for an e-commerce platform, using Node.js, Express.js, and MongoDB, which aligns well with the job description's requirements for backend web development, programming, and object-oriented programming. It also demonstrates experience with REST APIs, authentication, and database interactions. The job description mentions familiarity with React and Node.js, and while the backend itself doesn't use React, it's designed to interact with a React frontend (as indicated in the README). The listed dependencies and code summary contain technologies mentioned in the job description. It uses relevant databases like mongoDB and implements payment solutions like razorpay.

projects.name: BlogBackend

The use of JWT for authentication, Multer/Cloudinary for image uploads, and overall API design further supports the relevance. TypeScript is a plus.

projects.name: BlogFrontend
projects.reasoning: The repository demonstrates strong alignment with the job description. It showcases frontend development skills using React, TypeScript, and related technologies. The project involves backend interaction (REST API), user authentication, and implements core frontend functionalities needed for a blog application, all aligning well with the desired skills for the Software Engineer Intern role. The project lacks Node.js but focuses on frontend skills listed in the Job description.

projects.name: HospitalManagementBackend
projects.reasoning: The repository is a Node.js/Express.js backend for a hospital management system, using MongoDB. It implements REST APIs, authentication (JWT, bcrypt), and other middleware like CORS, cookie parsing, and file uploads. It aligns very well with the back-end web development, programming, and OOP requirements of the internship, as well as the familiarity with Node.js that is beneficial. The stack is very relevant.
